intro: Pasania wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan pasania, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in forested areas at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
